reporting-org.narrative: Ministerstvo zahraničných vecí a európskych záležitostí SR
Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs of the Slovak Republic

title.narrative: GLOBSEC: Raising Young People's Awareness of Globalization and Regional Security
GLOBSEC: zvýšenie povedomia mladých ľudí v oblasti globalizácie a regionálnej bezpečnosti

description.narrative:
MFEA SR is a co-sponsor of Dr. Predrag Simić Award - the professor of the Faculty of Political Sciences of the University of Belgrade, and the former director of the Institute for International Politics and Economics. The Faculty of Political Sciences of the University of Belgrade annually announces the themes for obtaining the Award with main focus on world and regional foreign and security policy.

On the occasion of the Dr. Predrag Simić First Award in 2016 Minister Miroslav Lajčák was also present. Lajčák gave a speech named "Serbia on the Road to European Integration". Professor Simić's work should be the source of facts and knowledge, and his personal pattern had become the symbol of the new generation of young people. By developing the themes, young people's views on the possibilities of improving the bilateral relations of the countries of the region and increasing its security and stability are gained.

The Faculty of Political Sciences announced topics for the third year of the Dr. Predrag Simić Award in November 2017:
- The possibility of improving and facilitating regional cooperation in the Balkans
- The best model for a long-term solution to the problem of Belgrade-Pristina relations
- The basic objectives of Serbian regional policy from the point of view of the Serbian nation and the surrounding countries
- The best and lasting model for the future of Bosnia and Herzegovina

Dr. Predrag Simić built his attitude to the reforms in Serbia based on the example of the Slovak example. Therefore, it is also in the interest of the Slovak Republic to keep students acquainted with the functioning of Slovakia as a full member of the EU in the international space. That is why MZVaEZ SR proposes a study course of award-winning students to the GLOBSEC 2018 Security Forum in Bratislava on 17th-19th May 2018.

The Faculty of Political Sciences of the University of Belgrade organized the third year of the "Dr. Predraga Simića ". MZVaEZ SR as a co-sponsor and with the approval of the Minister of ZVaEZ SR has praised this year's winners by attending the GLOBSEC 2018 conference. The aim is to make students familiar with the work of Slovakia as a full member of the EU in the international safe area. While staying in Slovakia, Serbian students, in addition to attending GLOBSEC, also meet at the Pan-European Higher School, the Institute of European Studies and International Relations at the Faculty of Social and Economic Sciences and the Department of Political Science at the Faculty of Philosophy at Comenius University Bratislava and at MZVaEZ

MZVaEZ SR je kosponzorom Ceny Dr. Predraga Simića, zosnulého profesora Fakulty politických vied Univerzity v Belehrade a bývalého riaditeľa Inštitútu pre medzinárodnú politiku a hospodárstvo. Fakulta politických vied Univerzity v Belehrade každoročne vyhlasuje témy pre získanie uvedenej Ceny, zamerané na svetovú a regionálnu zahraničnú a bezpečnostnú politiku.

Pri príležitosti založenia Ceny Dr. Predraga Simića a prvého udeľovania v r. 2016 bol prítomný aj minister M. Lajčák, kde na fakulte aj vystúpil s prednášku pod názvom „Srbsko na ceste európskej integrácie“. Hlavným cieľom udeľovania tejto ceny je, aby práce profesora Simića boli prameňom faktov a vedomostí a jeho osobný vzor sa stal symbolom novej generácie mladých ľudí. Rozpracovaním tém sa získavajú aj názory mladých ľudí na možnosti zlepšovania bilaterálnych vzťahov krajín regiónu a zvyšovania jeho bezpečnosti a stability.

Fakulta politických vied vypísala v novembri 2017 už tretí ročník súťaže na získanie Ceny Dr. Predraga Simića za najlepšie študentské práce na témy:
- Možnosť zlepšenia a uľahčenia regionálnej spolupráce na Balkáne
- Najlepší model dlhodobého riešenia problému vzťahov Belehrad-Priština
- Základné ciele srbskej regionálnej politiky z pohľadu srbského národa a okolitých krajín
- Najlepší a trvalý model budúcnosti Bosny a Hercegoviny

Dr. Predrag Simić svoj postoj k reformám v Srbsku vybudoval na základe poznania slovenského príkladu. Preto je aj v záujme Slovenskej republiky, aby sa študenti naďalej oboznamovali s pôsobením Slovenska ako plnoprávneho člena EÚ v medzinárodnom priestore. Práve preto MZVaEZ SR navrhuje študijnú cestu ocenených študentov na bezpečnostné fórum GLOBSEC 2018 v Bratislave v termíne 17.-19.5.2018.

Fakulta politických vied Univerzity v Belehrade organizovala už tretí ročník súťaže „Cena Dr. Predraga Simića“. MZVaEZ SR ako kosponzor a so súhlasom ministra ZVaEZ SR ocenil tohtoročných víťazov možnosťou zúčastniť sa na konferencii GLOBSEC 2018. Cieľom cesty je, aby sa študenti oboznámili s pôsobením Slovenska ako plnohodnotného člena EÚ v medzinárodnom bezpečnom priestore. Počas pobytu na Slovensku srbskí študenti okrem účasti na GLOBSEC realizujú stretnutia aj na Paneurópskej vysokej škole, v Ústave európskych štúdií a medzinárodných vzťahov na Fakulte sociálnych a ekonomických vied a Katedre politológie Filozofickej fakulty na Univerzite Komenského Bratislava a na MZVaEZ SR.

organisation.narrative: Fakulta politických vied, Univerzita v Belehrade

description.narrative:
Thursday, 17th May

08:45 Transfer to Institute of European Studies and International Relations (IESIR)
09:30 Meeting with Dr. Olga Gyarfasova, IESIR associate professor and director, attending her lesson „Political Sociology“

11:10–11:45 Business Lunch with Mr Jan Cingel at Business Garden restaurant
11:45 Transfer to GLOBSEC Bratislava Forum venue

12:15–12:30 GLOBSEC Official Welcome - H.E. Miroslav Lajčák, Minister of Foreign and European Affairs of the Slovak Republic, President of the 72nd Session of the United Nations General Assembly, introduced by Ambassador Rastislav Káčer, Honorary Chairman, GLOBSEC, Bratislava

12:15–12:30 GLOBSEC Opening Speech - H.E. Andrej Kiska, President of the Slovak Republic

12:30–13:15 GLOBSEC Brainstorming

13:15 – 13:45 Coffee Break

13:45 – 15:15 The West and Russia: Managing The Flashpoint
15:15 – 15:45 Coffee Break

15:45 – 17:15 Multilateralism in The “Me-First” World With No Rules
17:45 – 19:15 En Grande! Towards European Defence Union?

17:45 – 19:15 Cyberwar: Military Build-Up in The Fifth Domain

19:45 Buses leave from The Grand Hotel River Park Lobby

20:30 GLOBSEC Cocktail – "100 Years of Technologies and Beyond"
Venue: The Refinery Gallery,
The dress code: business formal


Friday, 18th May

08:15 Transfer to Pan-European University „Media Center“
Address: Nevädzová 5, Bratislava

09:00 – 10:00 Visiting Pan-European University Media Center
10:00 – 10:10 Transfer to Pan-European University „Courtroom“
Address: Tomášikova 20, Bratislava

10:10 – 10:30 Visiting Pan-European University Courtroom

10:30 Transfer to GLOBSEC Bratislava Forum venue
Address: Grand Hotel River Park, Dvorakovo Nabrezie 6, Bratislava

12:00 – 13:30 Lunch

13:30 – 14:30 The Western Balkans Chessboard
Venue: Maria Theresia, Grand Hotel River Park

14:30 – 15:30 Coffee Break

15:30 – 16:30 Trump´s Transatlantic Bond
Venue: Danube Space, River Park Plaza

16:30 – 17:00 Coffee Break

17:00 – 17:30 GLOBSEC Chat: Projecting Power in the post-Rule World Order
Joseph Nye, Distinguished Service Professor, Harvard Kennedy School, Harvard University, Cambridge
Venue: Danube Space, River Park Plaza

18:00 – 19:00 Visegrad Refining Relationship With Europe

Saturday, 19th May

08:15 Transfer to GLOBSEC Bratislava Forum venue

09:00–10:30 Too Much Intel, Too Little Action
10:30 – 11:00 Coffee Break

11:00 – 12:00 Explosive Data: Cyber Threats to Democracy
11:00 – 12:00 Terrorism (Not) Bad for Business

12:00 – 12:30 Coffee Break

12:30 – 13:30 Ukraine: Out of Tune With Europe?
13:30 – 13:45 Closing Remarks - Róbert Vass, President, GLOBSEC, Bratislava

13:45 Farewell Lunch

15:00 – 19:00 The Cyberstability Hearings of the Global Commission for The Stability of Cyberspace
